frameDefinitions: This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
A Visitor arrives at the Host_location as a guest of the Host, for the purpose of achieving a Purpose.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals.
This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event.
Due to internal forces/properties, an Entity is inclined towards a particular Behavior, which may be to perform an action or to maintain a state.
frameExamples: It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
I'm gonna <t>drop</t> <t>in</t> on Kieth for a while.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
He found them in the <t>deluge</t> of papers on his desk.
China will have to face a high <t>frequency</t> of sand storms in the years to come.
listRoleDefinitions: The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the Host_location to visit the <fen>Host</fen> for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The <fen>Host</fen> is the person highly associated with the goal location of the <fen>Visitor</fen>, and who allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> onto his/her territory, and possibly to make use of available resources. The <fen>Host</fen> and <fen>Visitor</fen> and in a host-guest relationship.
The <fen>Host_location</fen> is a place primarily associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.
The larger area within which the visiting takes place.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
The <fen>Quantity</fen>-denoting <t>Target</t> word.
A substance that is being quantified.
A collection of entities.
This role is used for any (bounded) <fen>Event</fen> whose frequency or iteration is described.
The extent to which the actually observed rate of occurrence of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> differs from the expected rate.
The <fen>Interval</fen> is a noun modified by the target word. The target word specifies the frequency of the <fen>Interval</fen> .
The <fen>Time_span</fen> is the length of time of the <fen>Interval</fen>. This role is incorporated by most of the lexical units in this frame.
The number of times per unit of real or scanning time that an <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is encountered.
An entity which the implicit cognizer encounters with the specified frequency.
The frequency feature of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is under discussion. All the lexical units in this frame incorporate this frame element.
The Time when the Event has a particular frequency.
TheFrame Element <fen>Entity</fen> identifies the person or thing that has a tendency towards some Behaviour.
The role <fen>Behavior</fen> marks expressions that indicate which state or action the <fen>Entity</fen> tends towards.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .
A modicum <fex>of seepage on the floor</fex> is to be expected.
A number <fex>of concerned citizens</fex> have raised objections.
The country has been struck by frequent <fex>economic crises</fex>.
The Crested Lark (Galerida cristata) is  <fex>very</fex> frequent from the coastal plain to the mountains.
You have to renew the license every <fex>year</fex> .
The state government spends its fiscal year 2006 budget of $23.4 billion at a rate <fex>of $742 per second</fex>.
It costs about US$2.50 to travel 200km (124 mi), but <fex>buses</fex> are infrequent and only one or two buses a day service most routes.
These exposures were likely to be intermittent <fex>in frequency</fex> occurring only when workers were participating in activities at these specific areas.
<fex>Lubomir</fex> was not inclined to believe me
Martha has a tendency <fex>to overdo the housekeeping</fex>.
